section.title: The Second Room
section.p: After seeing the room full of gold, the king was pleased but greedy for excited to see even more. He led the miller's daughter to an even larger room piled high with straw. The task was clear—she was to spin all of this straw into gold by morning. Without a word, he closed the door, leaving her alone.

section.title: Rumpelstiltskin Appears Again
section.p: Sitting on her small stool, the girl felt overwhelmed by the mountain of straw around her. The impossible task weighed on her, and she began to despair, doubting that the little man would return. In that moment, the same little man appeared as if summoned by her need. He looked at her with a sly mischievous grin, seeming to understand her plightproblem. This time, he asked for a more valuable item, and the girl reluctantly gave him her mother’s ring.

image.alt: Rumpelstiltskin appears to help the girl.

section.title: The Second Spinning
section.p: With the ring in his possession, the little man went to work. He spun the straw, filling the spools with precious golden threads that gleamed in the dim light. The wheel turned through the night, filling spool after spool. By dawn, every last piece of straw had been transformed into gold, and the little man vanished as silently as he had come. When the king entered and saw the room filled with gold, he felt a deep sense of satisfaction delight, already thinking of what else he might gain.
